post.description:
Run a container consists of two parts: create and start.

When the container is created, the creation information is saved to etcd.

> ReplicaSet is just an abstract concept, there is no concrete implementations,it just has to manage docker container, and save the container historical version information, that's all.

imageName.description: It's not automatically download from docker hub, you need to pull it locally first.

replicaSetName.description: Cannot cotainer '-', ReplicaSet managed containers will add version numbers, e.g. foo-0, foo-1.

gpuCount.description: If gpuCount is 0, the gpu is not used.

src.description: If starts with /, mounts the host's folders or files into the container.If it does not start with /, mount the docker volume into the container.

env.description: Environment variable, the format is like foo=bar.

containerPorts.description: The port number inside the container, with a randomly assigned host port number bound to it.

name.description: Container name of the new version created

post.summary: Commit container as a image via replicaSet
post.description: Commit replicaSet the current version of the container as an image.

newImageName.description: The name of the image you want

patch.description:
Rollback replicaSet the current version of the container toa specific version.

You can get all history of ReplicaSet version, via '/api/v1/replicaSet/:name/history'

containerName.description: Container name of the new version created

patch.description:
Patch the configuration of the latest version of existing container via create a new container and copy the old container system data to the new container.

Including changing the number of gpu and updating the volume binding.

If you request body is empty(e.g. {}), it will recreate a container based on the existing configuration.

> The old version container will be deleted.
> For example, if foo-1 calls the `/api/v1/replicaSet/:name` and create foo-2, foo-1 will be deleted.

gpuCount.description:
To adjust the number of gpus, it is so simple.
If you don't want to use the gpu, set it to 0.

oldBind.description: The old binding information, which you can get via '/api/v1/replicaSet/:name'.

newBind.description: If it is a docker volume, make sure it already exists.

volumePatch.description: First find the mount information by matching oldBind, then change it.

delete.description: Delete a replicaSet also delete the container and cannot be recovered.

get.description: Get information about the current version of the replicaset, which you can use to see the port number that the container exposes to the host or other information when the cotainer was created.

patch.description: Stop the current version of the replicaSet container, gpu and port will be released.
Pause the current version of the replicaSet container, gpu and port will not be release.
Continue to run the current version of the replicaSet container, it will call `docker restart`.
Restart the current version of the replicaSet container by recreate a container, it will reapply gpu and port.

containerName.description: Container name of the new version created

post.summary: Execute a command in the container via replicaSet
post.description: Execute a command in the replicaSet current version of the container.

get.description: Get information about all historical versions of the replicaSet.

post.description: Create a volume, you can specify the size and name.

size.description: Supported Units: KB, MB, GB, TB

name.description: Volume name of the new version created

delete.description:
Delete a volume.

The record in etcd will be deleted and cannot be recovered.

get.description: Get information about the current version of the volume.

patch.description:
Patch the size of the latest version of an existing volume via create a new volume and copy the old volume data to the new volume.

Including expand and shrink of two operations, if the size is the same before and after the operation,it will be skipped.

If the size already used is larger than the size after shrink, then shrink operation will fail.

> The old version volume will be deleted.
> For example, if bar-1 calls the `/api/v1/volumes/:name/size` and create bar-2, bar-1 will be deleted.

name.description: Volume name of the new version created

size.description: Volume size of the new version created

get.description: Get information about all historical versions of the volume.
